text: I get a lot of requests from my Indian
friends to come to India so I decided to
make this video with my honest thoughts
on the country which is a love-hate
relationship I spent three months
backpacking solo around India in early
2015 and my experience overall was
worthwhile and memorable so I'm here in
Mumbai in total I visited 13 cities
eight states and I covered a distance of
47 hundred kilometers I travelled
strictly by land from Goa to Mumbai
through Rajasthan up to Amritsar and
finally the Himalayas India is both
challenging and inspiring like a roller
coaster of ups and downs a sensory
overload a giant mix of good versus bad
happy versus evil and everything is
thrown at you in the face at the same
time I learned more about myself in
those three months than the last three
years nothing about that trip was luxury
I slept in budget hotels eight street
food took the cheapest trains and buses
to get around whenever I wasn't driving
myself and most of all I walked and
walked and walked and walked more than
20,000 steps a day I wanted the full
experience this was before I made videos
like I do today but luckily I filmed
some things on my GoPro which is the
footage you are seeing over my narration
the highlights of my trip to India were
celebrating Holi festival and Goa with
all night raves on the beach temple
hopping and humpy seeing the Wagah
border ceremony in Amritsar starring in
a Bollywood film playing cricket with
youngsters admiring the Taj Mahal going
on a three-day camel trek in jaisalmer
and relaxing in Rishikesh once again my
trip to India was very valuable and I
have no regrets about the experience
that people are overly nice the food is
tasty and the sights are very unique I
believe I saw India as well as
in three months that being said I
haven't been back to India over the last
few years for the following three
reasons overwhelming attention severe
food poisoning and a near-death
experience overwhelming attention India
is intense for someone like myself who
has red hair and white skin I also stand
out in places around Africa but I was
less anxious because I had room to
breathe in India I get swarmed by people
from the second I step outside my hotel
until I get back we're talking about 1.4
billion people food poisoning
unfortunately I was brutally food
poisoned three times within three months
food poisoning in India is ten times
worse than I've had elsewhere hands and
knees down on the bathroom floor
throwing up her fiercely and so weak
that I couldn't crawl into bed
near-death experience one evening in
Rajasthan I bought it an overnight bus
from who diaper to joke for where I was
the only foreigner on board about an
hour in as I was about to fall asleep
the bus driver slammed on the brake and
sharply turned the wheel and the bus
flipped off the highway and was in
pieces my life flashed before my eyes
I was covered in glass in dirt from head
to toe and had bloody elbows and feet
but I was thankfully okay two people on
that bus didn't make it out alive
this was my snapchat the following
morning after this catastrophic event I
would love to give India another chance
this year with new perspectives and a
more optimistic attitude if I do end up
going back which places should I visit
any advice would be greatly appreciated
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
